tealsim.physics.em

Class ExploringElectricField

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.core.AbstractElement
      • teal.sim.simulation.Simulation3D
        • teal.physics.em.SimEM
          • tealsim.physics.em.ExploringElectricField
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, HasID, TElement, TElementManager, THasPropertyChange, HasFramework, HasEngineControl, TSimulation, HasGUI

    public class ExploringElectricField
extends SimEM
    An application to help the player learn how to deduce the local electric field direction using neighboring values of the electric potential surrounding the student's current location.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    John Belcher
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) double allowedAngleEdirection
      The maximum angle between the local E field direction and the direction chosen by the player for agreement between the two.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • arrowScale

        double arrowScale
        Scale for electric field vectors.

      • pointChargeRadius

        double pointChargeRadius
        Radius of the point charges in the scene

      • messages

        javax.swing.JTextArea messages
        Text area for messages to the user while playing the game.

      • clearText

        boolean clearText
        Flag for whether to clear text in the message area or not.

      • exploreNextSquare

        boolean exploreNextSquare
        Flag to determine whether the player has correctly guessed the direction of the E field. If false the player must do that before he or she can continue on to another location.

      • gameControls

        UIPanel gameControls
        UI panel for game controls

      • optionsGroup

        javax.swing.ButtonGroup optionsGroup
        ButtonGroup for the three choices of possible "invisible" charge configurations.

      • rad1

        javax.swing.JRadioButton rad1
        Radio button for the case where the user guesses that the two invisible charges are both positive.

      • rad2

        javax.swing.JRadioButton rad2
        Radio button for the case where the user guesses that the two invisible charges are both negative.

      • rad3

        javax.swing.JRadioButton rad3
        Radio button for the case where the user guesses that the two invisible charges are + and -.

      • findPotentialButton

        javax.swing.JButton findPotentialButton
        Button for finding out the potential in surrounding squares. Player must have correctly guessed E in previous location before this button will set the potential in the new area.

      • PotentialPower

        double PotentialPower
        Scaling power for the potential. To reduce the range in potential we plot the potential raised to the PotentialPower power, preserving the sign.

      • allowedAngleEdirection

        double allowedAngleEdirection
        The maximum angle between the local E field direction and the direction chosen by the player for agreement between the two.

      • widthPlayingField

        double widthPlayingField
        The width of the total player field. The playing field is made up of nsquares * nsquares squares.

      • halfnsquares

        int halfnsquares
        The number of squares on a side of the field divided by 2, rounded to lowest integer.

      • nsquares

        int nsquares
        The number of squares on a side of the field. This is guaranteed to be an odd number by method of construction from halfnsquares.

      • widthSquare

        double widthSquare
        The width of a square. This is computed from the total width of the field and the number of squares on a side.

      • wrongGuessPenalty

        int wrongGuessPenalty
        Penalty for incorrectly choosing the direction of the E field.

      • squares

        Wall[][] squares
        The squares making up the playing field.

      • theArrows

        FieldVector[][] theArrows
        The electric field vectors at the location of the squares.

      • theDirectionAngles

        double[] theDirectionAngles
        The angles of the various direction choices on the keypad (1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9). The direction of 5 is arbitrary because this is the center of the keypad.

      • visited

        boolean[][] visited
        A flag to tell whether a given square has been previously visited or not.

      • Score

        int Score
        The score of the game.

      • idX

        int idX
        The location of the player in the x plane. This is an integer running from 0 to nsquares-1, corresponding to squares from the lower x value of the field to the upper x value of the field.

      • idY

        int idY
        The location of the player in the y plane. This is an integer running from 0 to nsquares-1, corresponding to squares from the lower y value of the field to the upper y value of the field.

      • scaleZdirection

        double scaleZdirection
        The scale in the z direction for the potential. The values of the z coordinate will run from -scaleZdirection*widthPlayingField to +scaleZdirection*widthPlayingField as the potential runs from minPotential to maxPotential,

      • maxPotential

        double maxPotential
        Once a charge configuration is chosen, this is the maxPotential seen over the player field for that configuration.

      • minPotential

        double minPotential
        Once a charge configuration is chosen, this is the minPotential seen over the player field for that configuration.

      • rand

        java.util.Random rand
        A random number used to generate positions and charges of the invisible charges for each game.

      • pcA

        PointCharge pcA
        One of two point charges.

      • pcB

        PointCharge pcB
        One of two point charges.

      • mDLIC

        protected FieldConvolution mDLIC
        Field convolution for displaying the field once the player has won.

      • observer

        Rendered observer
        The position of player projected into the xy plane, using a native shape (a sphere).

      • iconobserver

        Rendered iconobserver
        An imported 3DS object (a lego man icon for the observer).

      • observerNode

        Node3D observerNode
        A 3D node for the observer icon.

      • iconobserverNode

        Node3D iconobserverNode
        A 3D node for the lego man icon.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Programmed response to user actions.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:
        actionPerformed in class Simulation3D
        Parameters:
        e - is the action event performed by the user that we respond to.

      • addActions

        void addActions()
        Adds actions.

      • checkEdirectionGuess

        public boolean checkEdirectionGuess(int choice)
        Checks to see if the local electric field direction and the user's guess for that direction agree within 50 degrees.
        Parameters:
        choice - is an integer from 0 to 8 which indicates the nine different choices the user can make on the keypad for the E field direction.

      • getPosition

        javax.vecmath.Vector3d getPosition(int x,
                                   int y)
        Gets the spatial position of the square given its indices.
        Parameters:
        x - is the integer describing the x postion of the square
        y - is the integer describing the y position of the square.

      • getPotentialMaxMin

        public void getPotentialMaxMin()
        Once a configuration of charges is selected, finds the maximum and minimum potential at the center of the squares.

      • getScaledPotential

        double getScaledPotential(int x,
                          int y)
        Gets the scaled potential at this point. The scaled potential varies from minPotential to maxPotential over the z distance -scaleZdirection*widthPlayingField to +scaleZdirection*widthPlayingField.
        Parameters:
        x - integer indicating the x location of the point.
        y - integer indicating the y location of the point.
        Returns:
        scaled potential at this point.

      • getScore

        java.lang.String getScore()
        Outputs current score to the player.

      • moveObserver

        public void moveObserver()

      • moveObserverFromKeypad

        public void moveObserverFromKeypad(char code)

      • moveSquare

        public void moveSquare(int x,
                       int y)
        Move a square to the proper z direction based on the scaled potential.
        Parameters:
        x - the integer indicating the x position.
        y - the integer indicating the y position.

      • moveSquares

        public void moveSquares()
        Move the squares in the immediate neighborhood of the current observer position to their proper z position based on the scaled potential.

      • newGame

        public void newGame()
        Sets up a new game.

      • powerPotential

        public double powerPotential(double potential)
        Raises the real potential to the power PotentialPower, preserving the sign. This is done so that the range of variation in potential values is not as large as if we were to use the potential itself. PotentialPower is usually 1/3 or less.
        Parameters:
        potential -
        Returns:

      • quadrantLocation

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3d quadrantLocation(int rand)
        Sets the left hand lower position of the quadrants (0,1,2,3). This is part of the process of choosing the location of the invisible charges.
        Parameters:
        rand - The integer indicating which of the four quadrants we are considering.
        Returns:
        The location of the left hand corner of this quadrant.

      • resetCamera

        public void resetCamera()
        Resets camera view to its original value.
        Overrides:
        resetCamera in class Simulation3D

      • scoreMessage

        public void scoreMessage()

      • sendPlayerMessage

        public void sendPlayerMessage(java.lang.String str)

      • showResults

        public void showResults()
        When the game is over, show the location of the charges and move all of the squares to their proper position in the z direction. Also make visible all the electric field directions.
